children.subject: Directly use Calcentral shopping cart to add the conflicted classes.
Is there any way to make schedule planner allow overlapping classes?  When I try to add conflicting classes it doesnt let me.

Is this for Fall 2018?  If so, please email cs-enrollments@eecs.berkeley.edu and include the name of the 2 classes you are trying to enroll in along with your SID.


If this is for Summer 2018, be aware that time conflicts are not allowed for summer session classes and the system is working as designed.
It is indeed for Fall 2018. I sent off the email, thank you for your help!

I tried adding CS 188 directly but got the following error:

Is that an actual error? Or does it mean that CS 188 won't be webcasted and therefore we can't sign up for time conflicting classes?

EDIT: The class it would conflict with doesn't have a final, so that shouldn't be an issue.

history.content:
Good news! We are now able to, and have set up EE and CS classes in Cal Central to AUTOMATICALLY PROCESS time conflicts with other classes. (No more having to submit a request or complete the Google form!)

However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into time conflicted EE and CS classes, it is still your responsibility to plan your schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts (including midterms and finals). The Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor-Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

Time Conflicts and Wait list Processing

Students who enroll into a time-conflicted class that is full will be placed on the wait list. What's new is that students with time conflicts will now be processed the same as students without time conflicts.

If you are waitlisted for a class that has a time conflict and are not moving up the wait list or into the class, it is because you do not meet a reserve cap requirement or you do not have sufficient units available to allow you to be enrolled without going over the unit limit for the phase.
history.subject: NEW for F18 - Time Conflicts AUTOMATICALLY PROCESSED for EECS Classes

history.content:
Good news! We are now able to, and have set up EE and CS classes in Cal Central to ALLOW time conflicts with other classes. (No more having to submit a request or complete the Google form!)

However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into time conflicted EE and CS classes, it is still your responsibility to plan your schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts (including midterms and finals). The Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor-Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

Time Conflicts and Wait list Processing

Students who enroll into a time-conflicted class that is full will be placed on the wait list. What's new is that students with time conflicts will now be processed the same as students without time conflicts.

If you are waitlisted for a class that has a time conflict and are not moving up the wait list or into the class, it is because you do not meet a reserve cap requirement or you do not have sufficient units available to allow you to be enrolled without going over the unit limit for the phase.
history.subject: NEW for F18 - Time Conflicts ALLOWED for EECS Classes
